No easy fine, no mere apology or formal expiation, will satisfy the world's demands, but every pound of flesh exacted is soaked with all its blood. The subtlest forms of suffering known to man are connected with the poisonous humiliations incidental to these results.

author: William James
quote: I am often confronted by the necessity of standing by one of my empirical selves and relinquishing the rest. Not that I would not. If I could, be... a great athlete and make a million a year, be a wit, a born -- vivant and a lady killer, as well as a philosopher, a philanthropist ... and saint. But the thing is simply impossible. The millionaire's work would run counter to the saint s; the bon-vivant and the philanthropist would trip each other up; the philosopher and the lady killer could not well keep house in the same tenement of clay. Such different characters may conceivably, at the outset of life. Be alike possible for a man. But to make any one of them actual, the rest must more of less be suppressed. So the seeker of his truest, strongest, deepest self must review the list carefully and pick out on which to stake his salvation. All other selves thereupon become unreal, but the fortunes of this self are real. Its failure are real failures, its triumphs real triumphs carrying shame and gladness with them.

These ideas are indulged till the day of departure arrives, the chaise is called, and the progress of happiness begins. A few miles teach him the fallacies of imagination. The road is dusty, the air is sultry, the horses are sluggish. He longs for the time of dinner that he may eat and rest. The inn is crowded, his orders are neglected, and nothing remains but that he devour in haste what the cook has spoiled, and drive on in quest of better entertainment. He finds at night a more commodious house, but the best is always worse than he expected.

quote: It seems that through sending weapons and men and using some Syrian workers they (the Syrians) want to say that Lebanon will face chaos as a result of their departure from Lebanon.

author: Walid Jumblatt
quote: Nowadays it has become more risky. They have listening devices stronger than the Lebanese Army. They have infiltrated everything.

author: Walid Jumblatt
quote: If I have any advice to give to the Syrian president it is to cooperate for the sake of the investigation or for the sake of uncovering the truth.

author: Carl Jung
quote: We are born at a given moment, in a given place and, like vintage years of wine, we have the qualities of the year and of the season of which we are born. Astrology does not lay claim to anything more.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.

author: Carl Jung
quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Often the hands will solve a mystery that the intellect has struggled with in vain.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health.

author: Carl Jung
quote: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.

author: Carl Jung
quote: If there is anything that we wish to change in the child, we should first examine it and see whether it is not something that could better be changed in ourselves.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The wine of youth does not always clear with advancing years; sometimes it grows turbid.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakens.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: I cannot love anyone if I hate myself. That is the reason why we feel so extremely uncomfortable in the presence of people who are noted for their special virtuousness, for they radiate an atmosphere of the torture they inflict on themselves. That is not a virtue but a vice.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: If one does not understand a person, one tends to regard him as a fool.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Space flights are merely an escape, a fleeing away from oneself, because it is easier to go to Mars or to the moon than it is to penetrate one's own being

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Psychoanalysis cannot be considered a method of education if by education we mean the topiary art of clipping a tree into a beautiful artificial shape. But those who have a higher conception of education will prize most the method of cultivating a tree so that it fulfils to perfection its own natural conditions of growth.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: In my case Pilgrim's Progress consisted in my having to climb down a thousand ladders until I could reach out my hand to the little clod of earth that I am.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us, something is out of tune.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Only what is really oneself has the power to heal.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: A man who has not passed through the inferno of his passions has never overcome them.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: There is no coming to consciousness without pain.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The pendulum of the mind oscillates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Neurosis is always a substitute for legitimate suffering.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that fits all cases

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The true leader is always led

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The wise man who is not heeded is counted a fool, and the fool who proclaims the general folly first and loudest passes for a prophet and Fnhrer, and sometimes it is luckily the other way round as well, or else mankind would long since have perished of stupidity.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: We can keep from a child all knowledge of earlier myths, but we cannot take from him the need for mythology

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: We should not pretend to understand the world only by the intellect. The judgement of the intellect is only part of the truth.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment and especially on their children than the unlived life of the parent.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: You can exert no influence if you are not susceptible toinfluence.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Resistance to the organized mass can be effected only by the man who is as well organized in his individuality as the mass itself.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: All the works of man have their origin in creative fantasy. What right have we then to depreciate imagination.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: There are as many nights as days, and the one is just as long as the other in the year's course. Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word 'happy' would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Sometimes, indeed, there is such a discrepancy between the genius and his human qualities that one has to ask oneself whether a little less talent might not have been better.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: When an inner situation is not made conscious, it appears outside as fate.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The unconscious is not just evil by nature, it is also the source of the highest good: not only dark but also light, not only bestial, semi-human, and demonic but superhuman, spiritual, and in the classical sense of the word, Adivine.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Today as never before it is important that human beings should not overlook the danger of the evil lurking withing them. It is unfortunately only too real, which is why psychology must insist on the reality of evil and must reject any definition that regards it as insignificant or actually non-existent.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Psychology does not know what good and evil are in themselves; it knows them only as judgments about relationships.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: In the end, the only events of my life worth telling are those when the imperishable world erupted into this transitory oneâ€¦ All other memories of travels, people and my surroundings have paled beside these interior happeningsâ€¦ But my encounters with the 'other' reality, my bouts with the unconscious, are indelibly engraved on my memory. In that realm there has always been wealth in abundance, and everything else has lost importance by comparison.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: There can be no transforming of darkness into light and of apathy into movement without emotion.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The debt we owe to the play of imagination is incalculable.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: We need more understanding of human nature, because the only real danger that exists is man himself . . . We know nothing of man, far too little. His psyche should be studied because we are the origin of all coming evil.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Where love rules, there is no will to power; where power predominates, there love is lacking. The one is the shadow of the other.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: But, if you have nothing at all to create, then perhaps you create yourself.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Creative powers can just as easily turn out to be destructive. It rests solely with the moral personality whether they apply themselves to good things or to bad. And if this is lacking, no teacher can supply it or take its place.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances. If there is any reaction, both are transformed.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The images of the unconscious place a great responsibility upon a man. Failure to understand them, or a shirking of ethical responsibility, deprives him of his wholeness and imposes a painful fragmentariness on his life.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: It is on the whole probably that we continually dream, but that consciousness makes such a noise that we do not hear it.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The most intense conflicts, if overcome, leave behind a sense of security and calm that is not easily disturbed. It is just these intense conflicts and their conflagration which are needed to produce valuable and lasting results.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Nothing has a stronger influence psychologically on their environment, and especially on their children, than the unlived lives of the parents

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Caution has its place, no doubt, but we cannot refuse our support to a serious venture which challenges the whole of the personality. If we oppose it, we are trying to suppress what is best in man --his daring and his aspirations. And should we succeed, we should only have stood in the way of that invaluable experience which might have given a meaning to life. What would have happened if Paul had allowed himself to be talked out of his journey to Damascus?

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Without this playing with fantasy no creative work has ever yet come to birth. The debt we owe to the play of the imagination is incalculable.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: I could not say I believe. I know! I have had the experience of being gripped by something that is stronger than myself, something that people call God.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The word ''belief'' is a difficult thing for me. I don't believe. I must have a reason for a certain hypothesis. Either I know a thing, and then I know it --I don't need to believe it.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Good advice is often a doubtful remedy, but generally not dangerous because it has so littleeffect......

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: We deem those happy who from the experience of life have learnt to bear its ills without being overcome by them.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: Man needs difficulties; they are necessary for health.

author: Carl Gustav Jung
quote: The more one sees of human fate and the more one examines its secret springs of action, the more one is impressed by the strength of unconscious motives and by the limitations of free choice

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: We'll see if that keeps happening, ... You have to do what you have to do. I'm not going to worry about numbers. I'm just going to go out and do my job.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: I think he was awesome. He loses his starting running back and he's able to overcome that with no problem.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: My job was just to kind of be a decoy on the back side, but we're always taught running things full speed, ... It kind of opened up, and we got six on the board.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: All I've asked for is an opportunity, and more times than not I grab the bull by the horns.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: You never know when your opportunity is going to come to get open,

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: Hopefully, I can bring some of that Super Bowl magic here.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: I kind of think his knowledge of what it's going to take, what we need to do, are going to hopefully pay dividends for us. But we realize Carolina has been in the same position that we have, maybe a couple more times than us. ... It's going to be a great game. There's two coaches and two great teams that are going to be pitted against each other.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: It's Game 1. By no stretch of the imagination should the Seahawks hang their heads. Look what happens in this league. There are ups and downs, and this is our first down.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: It's Game 1, ... By no stretch of the imagination should the Seahawks hang their heads. Look what happens in this league. There are ups and downs, and this is our first down.

author: Joe Jurevicius
quote: I've always felt confident in my ability,

author: Juvenal
quote: When talent fails, indignation writes the verse.

author: Juvenal
quote: No man's contented just so much to sin - As you may license him

author: Juvenal
quote: Revenge is always the weak pleasure of a little and narrow mind

author: Juvenal
quote: Avarice increases with the increasing pile of gold

author: Juvenal
quote: Nature, in giving tears to man, confessed that he had a tender heart; this is our noblest quality

author: Juvenal
quote: The blind envy the one-eyed

author: Juvenal
quote: Many suffer from the incurable disease of writing, and it becomes chronic in their sick minds.

author: Juvenal
quote: For women's tears are but the sweat of eyes.

author: Juvenal
quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.

author: Juvenal
quote: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Writing is the incurable itch that possesses many.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Wisdom overcomes fortune.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: The smell of profit is clean and sweet, whatever the source.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: It is sheer madness to live in want in order to be wealthy when you die.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Two things only the people anxiously desire, bread and the circus games.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Your prayer must be for a sound mind in a sound body.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: A man who has nothing can whistle in a robber's face.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Those who desire to become rich, desire it at once.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: From where can your authority and license as a parent come from, when you who are old, do worse things?

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: A hairy body, and arms stiff with bristles, give promise of a manly soul.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: A lucky man is rarer than a white crow.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Integrity is praised and then left out in the cold.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: It is a wretched thing to live on the fame of others.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: We are too quick to imitate depraved examples.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Many commit the same crime with a different destiny; one bears a cross as the price of his villainy, another wears a crown.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: Even savage animals can agree among themselves.

author: (Decimus Junius Juvenalis) Juvenal
quote: The short bloom of our brief and narrow life flies far away. While we are calling for flowers and wine and woman, old age is upon us.
